Format Estimates with Confidence Intervals

Source: R/utilities.R
format_est_ci.Rd

Formats point estimates with confidence intervals in the style: "2.34 [1.23, 3.45]"

Usage

format_est_ci(est, lo, hi, digits = 2, percent = FALSE)

Arguments

est

Numeric vector of point estimates

lo

Numeric vector of lower confidence bounds

hi

Numeric vector of upper confidence bounds

digits

Integer. Number of decimal places (default 2)

percent

Logical. Format as percentages? (default FALSE)

Value

Character vector of formatted estimates with CIs

Examples

# Single value
format_est_ci(2.34, 1.23, 3.45)  # "2.34 [1.23, 3.45]"
#> [1] "2.34 [1.23, 3.45]"

# Multiple values
format_est_ci(
  est = c(2.34, 5.67),
  lo = c(1.23, 4.56),
  hi = c(3.45, 6.78)
)
#> [1] "2.34 [1.23, 3.45]" "5.67 [4.56, 6.78]"

# More decimal places
format_est_ci(2.3456, 1.2345, 3.4567, digits = 3)
#> [1] "2.346 [1.234, 3.457]"

# As percentages
format_est_ci(0.234, 0.123, 0.345, percent = TRUE)  # "23.4% [12.3%, 34.5%]"
#> [1] "23.40% [12.30%, 34.50%]"
